concept.title: What is Couchbase Server?
concept.shortdesc: Couchbase Server is a scalable, high-performance, highly available, distributed NoSQL database with a flexible data model. Applications can use Couchbase Server as a document database, a key-value store or a distributed caching tier.

section.title: Couchbase Server supports mission-critical applications
section.p: Couchbase Server supports mission-critical enterprise applications with a set of key capabilities:

li.p: Elastic scalability: Couchbase Server is engineered for online, elastic scaling. You can add or remove nodes in a Couchbase Server cluster on demand without any downtime. As the topology of the cluster changes, no manual partitioning is required—it’s automatic.

Consistent high performance: Couchbase Server implements a memory-centric architecture enabling memory-to-memory replication, in-memory updates to indexes, and asynchronous persistence to storage devices. With an integrated and managed object cache, Couchbase Server maintains submillisecond response times while supporting highly concurrent reads and writes with fine-grained locking.

Always available: Couchbase Server protects against failures with a streaming, memory-based protocol to replicate changes to multiple nodes, multiple racks, and multiple data centers with low latency. With automatic failover, topology-aware clients reroute requests around the failure when a node fails. Couchbase Server administrative functions can be performed with zero downtime, including software updates and upgrades.

Flexible, global deployment: Couchbase Server implements secure, cross data center replication (XDCR). With XDCR, applications can distribute data globally with unidirectional and bidirectional replication with flexible topologies ranging from one-to-one replication, one-to-many replication, and many-to-many replication. With global deployments using XDCR, Couchbase Server achieves higher availability and increased data locality.

Enterprise-grade administration: Couchbase Server is engineered to enable management and monitoring of large-scale deployments with enterprise-grade administration. It features a complete, integrated administration console while supporting scripting with CLI and REST interfaces. Couchbase Server exposes a comprehensive set of metrics and cluster-wide monitoring and diagnostics. With automated scaling, failover, and recovery, Couchbase Server allows you to perform complex tasks with the push of a button, resulting in efficient and effective administration of large deployments.

Real-time big data: Couchbase Server integrates with and extends the Hadoop ecosystem. With N1QL queries, global secondary indexes, and incremental MapReduce, Couchbase Server can index and query large data sets in real time to extend Hadoop's offline analytics capabilities. You can export operational data from Couchbase Server to Hadoop for analysis and import analytical results into Couchbase Server for improved operational effectiveness. In addition, Couchbase Server can stream data to external applications such as Elasticsearch, Storm, and Kafka.

Developer focused: Couchbase Server provides a simplified data modeling surface for all types of applications with JSON and easy data access combined with powerful query capabilities through SQL. You can implement mission-critical applications that reply on Couchbase Server's low latency, high availability, and high scalability. Couchbase Server includes native client libraries for multiple languages including Java, .NET, Go, and Node.js for simplified programmability in your favorite language or framework.

Data mobility: Couchbase Mobile includes Couchbase Server, Couchbase Sync Gateway, and Couchbase Lite. Couchbase Lite is an embedded database for iOS, Android, Microsoft Windows, and Linux enabling offline data access and automatic data synchronization. Couchbase Sync Gateway enables Couchbase Server to extend to mobile phones, tablets, and connected devices with secure authentication and authorization.

section.title: Couchbase Server supports many use cases
section.p: Couchbase Server is a multimodel, general-purpose database that can be used as a powerful distributed document database, a key-value store, and an integrated cache tier. Couchbase Server can support many use cases, including these:

li.p: Profile management applications to support authentication, preferences, and more over multiple channels.
Content management systems that can organize a variety of static and dynamic content without the limitations of a fixed data model.
360-degree customer view systems that aggregate full customer information from disparate sources with different schemas within a single database.
Fraud detection systems that enable real-time transaction profiling with low-latency access to accounts and fraud detection rules.
Internet of everything systems that collect high-volume, high-velocity sensor and telemetry data from industrial and consumer devices for intelligent systems.
Digital communication applications that support real-time interaction and communication with low latency read or write access to messages.
Personalization applications that ingest clickstream data at high throughput to create and refine millions of visitor profiles.
Mobile applications that can work offline via an embedded database and automatic synchronization.
Catalogs serving platforms that engage customers by providing low-latency access to product or service catalogs, online or in-store.
Real-time big data applications that leverage the full spectrum of analytics by extending the Hadoop ecosystem with real-time and interactive data access.

section.title: Couchbase Server is different from traditional RDBMSs
section.p: Couchbase Server has some key characteristics and advantages that make it superior to traditional relational database management systems (RDBMSs). The following table highlights the differences:

row.entry: Couchbase Server
Traditional relational database (RDBMS)
Rapidly scalable to millions of users.
Scalable to thousands of users.
Data can be structured, semi-structured, and unstructured.
Data must be normalized.
Built on modern reality of relatively inexpensive, plentiful memory.
Built on assumption of scarce, expensive memory.
Built for environments with high-speed data networking.
Built at a time when networking still formative and slow.
Data can be flexibly stored as JSON documents or binary data. No need to predefine data types.
Data types must be predefined for columns.
Significantly slower times for retrieving and committing data. Designed for occasional, smaller read/write transactions and infrequent larger batch transactions.
Data stored as key-document pairs; well suited for applications which handle rapidly growing lists of elements.
Data stored in tables with fixed relations between tables.
Does not require extensive data modeling; data structure is of lesser significance during development.
Data modeling and establishing relational model for data structures required during application development.
Asynchronous operations and optimistic concurrency enable applications designed for high throughput.
Strict enforcement of data integrity and normalization, with the trade-off of lower performance and slower response times.

section.p: The key advantages of Couchbase Server over a traditional RDBMS are:

li.p: Stores many serialized objects
Stores dissimilar objects that do not fit a single schema
Scales out from thousands to millions of users rapidly
Performs large volume reads and writes
Supports schema and application data changes on running system

section.p: If you need a system that provides a high level of scalability, flexibility in data structure, support for multiple data models, and high performance, Couchbase Server is the NoSQL solution of choice.
